info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 27 at 5:09PM CDT until July 27 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Chicago IL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of northeast Illinois, including the following counties, Cook, DuPage and Kane.
* WHEN...Until 700 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Underpasses may be flooded. Roads and streets may be flooded.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 508 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to nearly stationary thunderstorms. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Elgin, Schaumburg, Hoffman Estates, Bartlett, Streamwood, Carol Stream, Hanover Park, Addison, St. Charles, West Chicago, Roselle, Bloomingdale, South Elgin, Wood Dale, Itasca, Gilberts, West Dundee, Sleepy Hollow, Wayne and Valley View. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Cook, IL; DuPage, IL; Kane, IL
